Rather play Splitgate, way more free items and much funnier grind on skins and lootboxes.

[h1] Overwatch 2: Amongst the Best Multiplayer Experiences Today [/h1]

[b] Positives [/b]
[list]
[*]Intense, rewarding, and balanced competitive gameplay
[*]Diverse ranked options, from open role to fixed roles (tank, support, DPS), with healthy playerbase and quick queues
[*]Exceptional graphical optimization and performance, offering a smooth gaming experience with minimal stutters or FPS drops
[*]State-of-the-art FPS mechanics and hero skills, providing polished and engaging gameplay
[*]Innovative Quality of Life (QoL) features, such as the ability to play deathmatch while waiting in queue 

[/list]
[b] Negatives [/b]
[list] 

[*]While OW2 offers somewhat interesting characters and lore, it falls short in both customization options and overall charm when compared to its primary rival, Paladins
[*]Questionable design choices, like the ability to change characters at any moment during a match
[*] Slow progression regarding unlocking new characters, which may be a competitive disadvantage in ranked matchmaking (example: 35 wins in tank role to unlock Ramattra)

[/list]

[b] Rating

[u] 9/10

the bad reviews only exist because the crybabies keep crying about the game having "paid skins" (like every free game) and because they went back on their word and made the PVE portion of the game paid (like it fucking matters)...

the core PVP gameplay (what actually matters) of the game is fun, somewhat balanced and better than your average competitive game.
